intro: Gastrolobium crenulatum, commonly known as the serrated wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that appear in late summer to autumn. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges, and its pods are typically hairy and elongated. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Gastrolobium crenulatum is also known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits soil fertility.
